group_works.title: Theater of the absurd: Luigi Pirandello: Six characters in search of an author
group_works.creator_credit: Ken Frankel, Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities

results.title: Theater of the absurd: Luigi Pirandello: Six characters in search of an author
results.creator_credit: Ken Frankel, Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the drama”.
An abridged presentation in English of Pirandello’s play in which six characters seek to exchange their fixed, frozen form in art for the uncertainty of life, to distinguish between dramatic reality and dramatic illusion, between acting and artifice in real life, and between reality and truth. Narrated by Joseph Heller.

results.title: The Delian problem (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Neil Cleminson, Jean Nunn, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
Examines the problem of duplicating the cube, which amounts to finding the cubic root of 2 and is known as the Delian problem. Discusses the reformation of this problem in terms of finding two mean proportionals and the solution of the simpler problem of one mean proportional.

results.title: The Rise of Hitler
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe, BBC-TV and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”
Describes the peace settlement after the 1914-18 War and its effects in Germany. Discusses the reasons for the rise of Hitler, the nature of his regime and the series of aggressive moves leading to war in 1939.

results.title: The Cold war
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the origin and development of the hostility between the United States and USSR after 1945, the formation of the system of anti-communist alliances around the world and the respective spheres of influence. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: History of Australian art. Part 1 (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian art”.
This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1788-1920. It investigates the European traditions, the Heidelberg School and the beginnings of Post-Impressionism and abstraction. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC, 2MB RAM, 1MB free disc space, 8 bit colour card, system 6.0.5 or higher, CD ROM XA. IBM PC and Compatible; Windows 3.1 or higher, 4MB RAM, 4MB free disk space, VGA display, MPC Compatible CD ROM XA.

results.title: New China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the main developments in China since 1949 - collectivization of land, the communes, the Great Leap Forward, plans for production, the Cultural Revolution and the Red Guard movement.

results.title: History of Australian art
results.brief_description: This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1788-1991. It investigates the European traditions, the Heidelberg School and the beginnings of Post-Impressionism and abstraction. From Margaret Preston to Brett Whitely, controversial modernist art, and the influence of American styles such as Abstract Expressionism. It also investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works.
results.description: This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1788-1991. It also investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works.

It investigates the European traditions, the Heidelberg School and the beginnings of Post-Impressionism and abstraction. It also investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works.

results.title: A History of Australian art. Part 3 (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian art”.
This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1970-1991. It investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC, 2MB RAM, 1MB free disc space, 8 bit colour card, system 6.0.5 or higher, CD ROM XA.
